newsitem.title: USA: N. Carolina sees 19.3 pct drop in welfare rolls.
newsitem.headline: N. Carolina sees 19.3 pct drop in welfare rolls.

text.p: North Carolina's welfare rolls have shrunk by 19.3 percent since the state began its "Work First" program 20 months ago, Gov. Jim Hunt said.
Welfare enrollment shrank from 113,485 families in June 1995 to 91,538 families as of March, the governor said in a news release Friday.

The program requires welfare recipients to find a job or enroll in a job training program within 12 weeks of receiving their first benefit check. It provides health care, transportation, and child care subsidies and helps participants find jobs through partnerships with business and church and social groups.
The program also makes one-time emergency grants to families experiencing temporary crises that would otherwise force them onto welfare rolls.
